items.content_html:
Summary

As per the Chrome roadmap, some of the Chrome version release dates have changed. This PR updates those.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Update Chrome release versions

items.content_html:
RTCStatsReport is "maplike" - see https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-pc/#dom-rtcstatsreport - which means it adds entries, keys, iterator ....

What this does is add a spec link for each of those maplike interfaces to https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-pc/#dom-rtcstatsreport and also a link to the MDN docs that are being added in mdn/content#27028
items.title: RTCStatsReport - add MDN links and speclinks for maplike

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for all browsers for the Tag.type member of the WebAssembly JavaScript builtin. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v9.3.2).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/javascript/builtins/WebAssembly/Tag/type
items.title: Update all browsers data for javascript.builtins.WebAssembly.Tag.type

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc API. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v9.3.1).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc

Additional Notes: Testing this WebGL extension in macOS, Windows and Android, it turns out that the only platform that supports it is Android.
items.title: Update Firefox data for WEBGL_compressed_texture_etc API

Additional Notes: Additional manual testing was performed to narrow down the version number from â‰¤13.1 to 3.

items.content_html: Safari 15 shipped WebGL 2 and these interfaces belong to WebGL 2.
items.title: Safari 15 supports WebGL2 interfaces

items.content_html: See WebKit/WebKit@78ef21e
items.title: Safari 7 implemented WEBGL_compressed_texture_pvrtc

items.content_html:
Summary

The Scroll-driven animations spec is being more or less supported in its entirety in Chromium 115. This PR adds BCD for the new properties, functions, and other syntax defined in this spec, plus some related features from the CSS Animations Level 2.

See my research document for more details as to what has been added.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Updated BCD for Scroll-Driven Animations spec

items.content_html:
Reverts #19614. The mdn-bcd-collector project says that these features are not supported. Looking at the ChromeStatus entry, I don't see any milestones marked, and the linked bug is Open.

(Also, FYI @chrisdavidmills, the version_removed of the flag data should have been 113, not 112, unless the feature was completely unavailable in Chrome 112 -- however, that flag data would have also qualified as an irrelevant flag and could be removed entirely!)
items.title: Revert "Update Storage Access API data"

items.content_html:
This PR is a breakdown list of all the changes created by https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com. This PR will be continuously updated, both on every new collector release and as needed.

Current results: collector v9.3.0/v9.3.1 (tests are the same in both versions), generated June 2, 2023
items.title: mdn-bcd-collector v9.3.1 breakdown (2023-06-02)

items.content_html: This PR removes the RTCRtpEncodingParameters API from BCD. This feature is a type (ex. a dictionary, enum, mixin, constant or WebIDL typedef) that we have explicitly stated not to document separately from the feature(s) that depend on it, as they are virtually invisible to the end developer.
items.title: Remove RTCRtpEncodingParameters API from BCD

items.content_html: This PR removes the RTCRtpContributingSource API from BCD. This feature is a type (ex. a dictionary, enum, mixin, constant or WebIDL typedef) that we have explicitly stated not to document separately from the feature(s) that depend on it, as they are virtually invisible to the end developer.
items.title: Remove RTCRtpContributingSource API from BCD
